comments.creator: nicolas.barbulesco@supinfo.com
comments.author: nicolas.barbulesco@supinfo.com
comments.raw_text:
Mac OS X 10.6.8 (10K540). Firefox 5.0.

I have a Firefox window containing several tabs.
I decide to drag the front tab.
If I drop it to a forbidden place, then the tab visibly moves back to its original position, so that I know that nothing happened.
But I drop the tab above the middle of the window.
So the tab gets promoted to its own window. This is correct.
But the tabs appears to move back to its original position, to make me wrongly believe that nothing happened. This is incorrect.

Thanks for fixing that little bug,

Nicolas
comments.text:

I have a Firefox window containing several tabs.

But I drop the tab above the middle of the window.
So the tab gets promoted to its own window. This is correct.
But the tabs appears to move back to its original position, to make me wrongly believe that nothing happened. This is incorrect.

Thanks for fixing that little bug,

comments.raw_text: This should be fixed by bug 465186. Could you check to see if it works for you on Aurora? (You can download that here: http://www.mozilla.com/en-US/firefox/channel/).

Thx.
